alert.note: Alert for Clark; Gray; Meade; Seward (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 12:43AM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Seward, southwestern Finney, Meade, southwestern Gray, southwestern Clark and eastern Haskell Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 1243 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Holcomb to 11 miles north of Knowles. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Garden City around 1255 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Englewood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for southwestern Kansas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for southwestern Kansas.
